node.title: Restrictions ease for Auckland and Northland, boosters approved, traffic light system on the horizon

node.title: Analysis - Jacinda Ardern has no reason to go - yet
node.description: The state is obliged to protect the population from deadly diseases but there's no simple or popular way to balance the public health, economic and political risks at the moment.

node.title: Connor Whitehead investigation: Man charged with murder
node.description: A 32-year-old man has been charged with murder following the death of the Christchurch teenager.

node.title: First officer to find Arbery wounded says he heard "death rattle"
node.description: Jurors were shown graphic, closeup police photos Monday of the gunshot wounds that killed Ahmaud Arbery.

node.title: Emily Ratajkowski opens up about career, female empowerment
node.description: The book is a collection of deeply personal essays from Ratajkowski's life and modeling career, focused on events that influenced her beliefs and identity.

node.title: Obama faults Russia and China for "dangerous lack of urgency" on climate
node.description: "When it comes to climate, time really is running out," the former president told climate advocates in Glasgow.

node.title: Shaq adds to $30,000 reward to find suspect who shot cop
node.description: The officer, who has served 17 years in law enforcement, is in critical condition.

node.title: Alec Baldwin calls for police officers to be on sets with guns
node.description: Actor Alec Baldwin called for production companies to hire police officers to monitor the safety of guns on movie and television sets.

node.title: Survivor shot by Kyle Rittenhouse thought he "was going to die"
node.description: Gaige Grosskreutz, 27, had a gun in has hand, with his arms raised, when Rittenhouse fired, shooting him in the bicep.

node.title: Ted Cruz called Big Bird's COVID-19 vaccine "propaganda"
node.description: Campaigns are often used to encourage important vaccinations – some of them even required for kids to enter schools.

node.title: Shalane Flanagan completes her sixth marathon in 42 days
node.description: She finished the race just over 2 hours, 32 minutes – her best out of the six marathons.

node.title: Gun maker Remington moving to Georgia from NY
node.description: Country's oldest gun maker heading to Georgia after emerging from second bankruptcy in wake of Sandy Hook carnage.

node.title: 16-year-old Florida student missing following school field trip
node.description: The student, Mia Brailford, was last seen the night of November 6.

node.title: China builds mock-ups of U.S. warships on apparent new target range
node.description: The independent U.S. Naval Institute says the dummy ships appear to include details like weapons systems and funnels. They're adding to concern over China's military ambitions.

node.title: Andrew Cuomo Accuses New York Sheriff of Illegally Leaking Grand Jury Documents to News
node.description: Cuomo's attorney claimed that Sheriff Craig Apple's actions have denied Cuomo of "both the presumption of innocence and a fair and impartial investigation."

node.title: French Catholic Church Will Sell Assets to Compensate Abuse Victims
node.description: The measure was one of several measures announced by French bishops, one month after a landmark report on sexual abuse by clergy members in France.

node.title: Bill Richardson Defends Trip to Myanmar to Talk COVID, Says He's Deeply Invested in Country
node.description: The U.S. government and other Western nations are opposed to Myanmar's military-installed government and call for a transition back to a democracy-led state.

node.title: The Rough Road to the $1 Trillion Bill
node.description: Readers discuss the battles and compromises that led to the infrastructure bill’s approval. Also: The "Havana syndrome."

node.title: ABC secures broadcast rights to WorldPride and Sydney Mardi Gras
node.description: The ABC has secured the broadcast rights for Sydney Mardi Gras for the first time in 28 years and WorldPride 2023 — the largest global event in NSW since the 2000 Olympic Games.

node.title: Why you're not as protected as you think when defects are found in your new home
node.description: Building a home is a huge investment. So when it goes wrong, it can be devastating. Here's what to do to make sure it goes to plan, and the steps you can take when it's all too late.

node.title: When a crowd surges forward, the artist on stage has a role to play
node.description: There is a lot we don't know about what occurred in the Astroworld Festival. But what Travis Scott did or did not do on stage in Houston is now being scrutinised. So what role does the artist play when it comes to 'mosh pit etiquette'?

node.title: Woman Avoids Death Sentence for Murder of Store Clerk After Partner Sentenced to Die
node.description: Bailey Boswell, 27, was convicted in October of 2020 of first-degree murder, conspiracy to commit murder and improper disposal of human remains.

node.title: Florida GOP Debuts 'Keep Florida Free' Legislation Taking Aim at COVID Mandates
node.description: The agenda was presented by Florida Governor Ron DeSantis and other party leaders before the state legislature is scheduled to reconvene.

node.title: ‘Her touch, her kiss’: A couple reunites as the U.S. reopens to vaccinated travelers.
node.description: Romantic partners and families rejoiced as they met in airports after long months of separation because of pandemic travel restrictions.

node.title: The new U.S. travel rules bring confusion for some and threaten exclusion for others.
node.description: Some eager travelers were frustrated by the timing and particulars of the new rules.

node.title: A Vegetarian Thanksgiving
node.description: Kay Chun’s new recipe for stuffed mushrooms with an escargot-flavored filling evokes the French classic.

node.title: They’ll Be So Blue Thinking About You
node.description: Rogue Creamery offers two gift boxes filled with blue cheeses from Oregon.

node.title: The Many Variations of Mexican Chicken Soup
node.description: Pati Jinich will discuss the comforts of regional chicken soup at a virtual class at the 92nd Street Y.

node.title: Refreshingly Bitter, This Spritz Is Ready to Move
node.description: Ramona’s latest canned offering is a light Amarino spritz from Italy.

node.title: Alsatian Delights From Gabriel Kreuther
node.description: The chef offers the recipes of his youth along with the finesse of his work in a lavish new cookbook.

node.title: More Than Just Olive Oil
node.description: Colive is a project designed to bridge the divide between north and south Cyprus.

node.title: The Emily Ratajkowski You’ll Never See
node.description: With her new book, the model tries to escape the oppressions of the male gaze. So our writer is keeping some of her secrets.

node.title: How an Artist Listens to the Voices in His Head
node.description: Josh Ritter talks about how his novel “The Great Glorious Goddamn of It All” changed as he wrote it and the importance of creative work that doesn’t eat up its creator.

node.title: Is the Supreme Court on Its Way to Becoming a Conservative Bastion?
node.description: Linda Greenhouse’s “Justice on the Brink” looks back at the Supreme Court’s last year, with intimations of what we can expect in the future.

node.title: Patricia Highsmith Lived Extravagantly, and Took Copious Notes
node.description: The writer’s newly released diaries and notebooks, spanning five decades from 1941 to 1995, are a record of hard work, wild nightlife and passionate love affairs.

node.title: Brazil’s Far-Right Disinformation Pushers Find a Safe Space on Telegram
node.description: In a social media ecosystem facing mounting pressure to combat fake news and polarization, Telegram is the most permissive disseminator of content — and disinformation.

node.title: A Chip Shop That’s Not a Chip Shop: Dame, in the Village
node.description: With exceptional fish and chips, the chef Ed Szymanski turned a pandemic pop-up into a postpandemic destination.

node.title: Randal Quarles, formerly the Fed’s vice chair for supervision, will leave the central bank at the end of December.
node.description: Mr. Quarles’s term as a governor could have stretched until 2032. His departure will give the Biden administration more room to remake the Fed.

node.title: Adding More Police to Fight Crime? The Evidence Is Mixed.
node.description: Other anti-crime measures might more effective, experts say, and avoid the downsides of policing.

node.title: Thousands of Canadians head for the southern United States again.
node.description: With the border opening to tourists, thousands of Canadian “snowbirds” are on their way to Florida, Arizona and California with campers in tow.

node.title: Elementary Schools Urged by White House to Set up COVID Vaccine Clinics for Students
node.description: The Food and Drug Administration says the shots are safe and proven to be almost 91 percent effective in preventing COVID-19 in a study of 2,268 children.

node.title: Simone Biles Taking Break From Gymnastics to Figure Out 'What I Really Want to Do'
node.description: "For me, it's just finding out what I really want to do," Biles said, adding that she is not sure whether the break will be temporary or permanent.

node.title: Athlete Welfare, Giving More Governing Power to Schools Among NCAA Restructuring Goals
node.description: The new constitution is the first phase of transforming the NCAA to give more power to schools and conferences, instead of the Indianapolis-based association.

node.title: Bear Caught Trying To Hibernate Under Family Home in Colorado
node.description: "We've had bears wander through before, but none settling in," resident Michael Payne said.

node.title: Man and Teenager Killed by Falling Tree Branches as Storm Batters Portland
node.description: The fourteen-year-old's aunt paid tribute to him saying "sweet, just a smiling, wonderful child who believed in volunteerism."

node.title: Elon Musk's Twitter Antics Prompt Launch of Risky Lorde Edge, Abide(N) Crypto Coins
node.description: Several new tokens appear to have been inspired by the SpaceX CEO's Twitter activity over the past two days, but people should be cautious about investing.

node.title: Rare 'Cotton Candy' Lobster Found Off Maine in 1 in 100 Million Catch
node.description: The lobster's unusual color is likely the result of a genetic mutation.

node.title: L.A. Businesses Could Be Fined Up to $5K if They Don't Enforce City's COVID Vaccine Mandate
node.description: The mandate will begin to be imposed on November 29. After the first offense warning, subsequent warnings could result in fines.

node.title: Most Russians Return to Work as Just 5 Regions Extend Non-Working Period
node.description: COVID-19 cases and deaths across Russia remain high as the country's coronavirus task force reported 39,400 infections and 1,190 deaths on Monday.

node.title: Airlines in U.S., U.K. Increasing Flights as Travel Rules Ease for International Residents
node.description: Flights between the U.S. and U.K. alone are projected to increase 21 percent this month, according to a travel analytics firm.

node.title: Barack Obama Says He 'Wasn't Real Happy' When Donald Trump Left Paris Accords
node.description: "When it comes to climate, time really is running out... we are nowhere near where we need to be," Obama said.

node.title: Poland Adds 2,000 Troops to Border Guard After Migrants Try to Enter by Force From Belarus
node.description: Officials said the Belarus government is "using them [migrants] to escalate the border crisis and provoke Poland."

node.title: Teen Remains Jailed Over Social Media Comments Criticizing Father's Political Opponent
node.description: Sixteen-year-old Kak Sovannchhay, who has autism, is accused of inciting to commit a felony and public insult.

node.title: French Catholic Church Will Sell Assets to Compensate Its 330,000 Sex Abuse Victims
node.description: "We felt disgust and horror inside us when we realized how much suffering so many people had lived and were still living," said a Church official.

node.title: 25 Kids at Afghan Hospital Died of Malnutrition in 2 Months, Staff Working Without Pay
node.description: Afghanistan has seen a huge surge in children's malnutrition cases because of drought and the worsening economic crisis under Taliban rule.

node.title: Families Want Court to Spell Out Russia's 'Despicable' Role in Downing Malaysia Air Flight
node.description: "Years of disinformation, alternative theories, denials, distortions and refusal to face responsibility....That is the Russian Federation," Piet Ploeg said.

node.title: White Supremacist Who Live-Streamed Mosque Massacre Says He Pleaded Guilty Under Duress
node.description: Brenton Tarrant pleaded guilty to all charges, including 51 counts of murder, for opening fire in two mosques in New Zealand on March 15, 2019.

node.title: Iceland Sets up World's Largest Air-Scrubbing Machines, but Environmental Impact Is Unclear
node.description: "We have already failed on climate to the extent to which direct air capture is one of the many things we must do," said a senior researcher.

node.title: Rick Scott Declines to Say if Candidate Accused of Strangling Wife Is 'Right Candidate'
node.description: When asked about accusations that Sean Parnell allegedly chocked his wife, Senator Rick Scott said he is "not supporting or opposing people in primaries."

node.title: Trump Supporter to Challenge GOP Congressman Who Voted To Impeach
node.description: Tim Ko, a physician assistant in neurosurgery, is hoping to appeal to Trump supporters who have lost faith in New York Rep. John Katko.

node.title: Churchgoers in Robes Praying Outside Planned Parenthood Spark Criticism
node.description: Video footage shows the group lined up outside Planned Parenthood with their heads bowed holding a cross and painting of the Virgin Mary.

node.title: Gaige Grosskreutz Testifies Rittenhouse Reloaded His Weapon While Holding Him at Gunpoint
node.description: "Re-racking the weapon, in my mind, meant the defendant wasn't accepting my surrender," Grosskreutz, who was shot in the arm, said.

node.title: U.S. Seizes $6M From Ransomware Hacker Suspected of Attacking Thousands of Companies
node.description: On Monday, the Justice Department announced it was filing charges against two individuals affiliated with the damaging ransomware group REvil.

node.title: Video Shows Thieves Ransacking Evacuated Apartments After a Fire Killed Child, Pet Dog
node.description: "People like that, to be honest, it's just despicable," burglary victim Alberto Revilla said. "We're being victimized double."

node.title: Tesla Stock Prices Dip After Elon Musk Proposes Selling 10 Percent of His Own Shares
node.description: The billionaire said the only way he can pay taxes is to sell Tesla stocks because he does not take a cash salary.

node.title: Man Praised for Refusing to Put Brother up for Adoption After Parents' Death in Viral Post
node.description: The man and his 14-year-old brother have no other living relatives—but his wife still believes the teenager should be put up for adoption.

node.title: Jeff Bezos Tweets Response to Viral Video of Interaction Between Partner, Leo DiCaprio
node.description: The video at the center of the playful feud was viewed more than 8 million times on social media by Monday morning.

node.title: Woman Says She 'Raised' Young Sisters After Parents Death in Viral Post, Friend Disagrees
node.description: "You absolutely did what was best for all 3 of you, for your futures. Having a way to NOT struggle as much doesn't make you less of a parent," said a commenter.

node.title: Alec Baldwin Says Police Should Be on Movie Sets That Use Guns Following 'Rust' Shooting
node.description: On October 21, Baldwin was filming "Rust" in New Mexico when a prop gun he was handling discharged, killing cinematographer Halyna Hutchins.

node.title: Chinese State Media Mocks U.S. Infrastructure Bill: 'Feeble Imitation of China'
node.description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act passed Friday includes $555 billion in new funding for roads, bridges, broadband and more.

node.title: Man Wants Exoneration in Triple Murder After Prosecutor Says He Was Wrongfully Convicted
node.description: Attorneys for Kevin Strickland will argue his case in an evidentiary hearing after legal procedures and canceled hearings resulted in months of delays.

node.title: Pandemic Recession Has Been More Harmful to Women, Fed Chair Says
node.description: The pandemic has taken a heavier toll on women with children, causing many to quit the workforce, leaving economists to speculate if a return is in sight.

node.title: Newborn Dies After COVID-Positive Mom Gives Birth 14 Weeks Early in Emergency Surgery
node.description: The baby tested positive for COVID-19 days after being born and suffered from complications of being born 14 weeks early.

node.title: U.S. Lags in Policing Big Tech Due to Companies Being Homegrown, Expert Says
node.description: Companies are likely arguing to Washington officials that tighter rules would give them a disadvantage as they compete with other companies, an expert said.

node.title: Kids Injured After School Bus Carrying 29 Students Runs Off Road, Crashes Into Creek
node.description: At least 13 students and the driver were taken to nearby hospitals after the bus crashed through a guard rail and took a 25-foot drop down a creek embankment.

node.title: Shaquille O'Neal Offers Cash to Find Person Who Shot, Wounded a Georgia Police Officer
node.description: "I assure you we're coming to find you, we will place you in custody and we will bring you to justice immediately," Sheriff Reginald Scandrett said.

node.title: Female Hockey Goalie Who Was Victim of Vulgar Chants From Students Returns to Ice
node.description: 50 to 60 students have been identified and punished for the incident, which occurred in Pennsylvania.

node.description: In one petition, a concertgoer claimed that Scott's show was a direct result of "a motivation for profit at the expense of concertgoers' health and safety."

node.title: Howard Stern Blasts Aaron Rodgers for Lying About Vaccine Status, 'C'mon Dude, Really?'
node.description: The Green Bay Packers quarterback has received criticism for previously telling reporters he was "immunized" against COVID-19.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery's Father Leaves Courtroom as Jury Shown Images of Son's Fatal Wounds
node.description: Defense attorneys said the suspects were justified in chasing Arbery to detain him and that Travis McMichael fired in self-defense during an altercation.

node.title: Swimming near sharks in freezing water might sound horrifying but for Ross Frylinck, it was life-changing
node.description: The South African filmmaker says his friend, creator of My Octopus Teacher Craig Foster, taught him that cold water swimming can seriously impact your life.

node.title: How much does your morning coffee cost? It could be about to get more expensive
node.description: Your morning coffee or the next cocktail on a night out could be about to cost you more, thanks to some lingering effects of the pandemic.

node.title: Barack Obama takes aim at China, Russia for missing COP26
node.description: The former US president calls for rich countries to help poorer nations battling the effects of climate change.

node.title: Niki's kids have had to isolate twice since the end of lockdown. She's had enough — and she's not alone
node.description: Niki Mahaffey is sick of homeschooling her two children. But two coronavirus exposures at school mean the family has had to isolate twice since the end of lockdown.

node.title: Trump, Biden 2024? How Their Supporters Feel About Potential Presidential Runs
node.description: If the election were held today, a new poll says, Trump would have the edge over the president.

node.title: War closes in on Ethiopia's capital
node.description: A rebel commander – part of a new alliance threatening the government in Adis Ababa – says it will all be over "very soon," as residents rally against the siege – and U.S. calls for peace talks.

node.title: U.S. lifts travel ban for specific countries. Here's overview
node.description: The U.S. will allow in international travelers, but they must be vaccinated — with a few exceptions.

node.title: Missing girl rescued after using TikTok hand signal to alert driver
node.description: The driver called 911 to report that a girl was making hand signals that he recognized from TikTok as a plea for help from domestic violence.

node.title: The Latest Trend in Baking? Making a Mess
node.description: A new generation of pâtissier is eschewing the primness and precision of traditional cakes and creating confections as delightful as they are subversive.

node.title: Northern Ireland’s health minister is suing Van Morrison over Covid-19 criticism
node.description: The Belfast-born singer-songwriter has embraced conspiracy theories and criticized restrictions to slow the spread of the coronavirus. Last year, he released a single called “No More Lockdown.”

node.title: Revolutionary War Battle Plan Features Early Usage of Term 'United States of America'
node.description: The document, which was created by Continental Army Major Moses Ashley in 1780, had been lost for generations.

node.title: Joe Biden Ranked Sixth in Approval Rating of World Leaders
node.description: Since taking office, Biden's approval rating has dipped a total of 6 percent, from 50 percent to 44 percent, a survey by Morning Consult Political Intelligence shows.

node.title: 'This Show Is Over': Safety Warning at Playboi Carti Gig Goes Viral After Astroworld
node.description: "Just one person messing up, the show is over," warned staff over the speaker system before Playboi Carti's LA show the day after eight died at Astroworld.

node.title: Jill Biden and the surgeon general are pushing for Covid shots in schools.
node.description: The Biden administration is evoking the campaign against polio in the 1950s as it seeks to vaccinate 28 million young children against the coronavirus.

node.title: Ancient Earth Hit by Rain Storms 100s of Miles Wide Due to Extreme Heat
node.description: Scientists compared periods of punishing rains and withering droughts in Earth's hothouse epochs to a giant atmospheric "battery" recharging then unleashing powerful storms.

node.title: WHO says U.S. should take a warning from Europe's COVID resurgence
node.description: As a 4th wave floods hospitals in some parts of the continent, a top WHO official urges the U.S. to bring back restrictions at the 1st sign of an uptick: "The earlier, the stricter, the better."

node.title: Palestinians Were Targeted by Israeli Firm’s Spyware, Experts Say
node.description: The hacking renewed scrutiny of the relationship between the Israeli government and the NSO Group, a surveillance company blacklisted by the United States.

node.title: California, Despite Strict Mandates, Sees Surge in COVID Infections
node.description: California's case rate is currently higher than that of Southern states without mask and vaccine mandates and with lower vaccination rates.

node.title: Barack Obama Returns to Climate Talks With a Call for ‘Ongoing Activism’
node.description: The American leader who helped seal the Paris climate accord arrived in Glasgow to cheers from delegates and pushback from some activists.

node.title: At 83, the ‘Nimblewill Nomad' is now the oldest to hike Appalachian Trail
node.description: For more than 3,500 kilometres this 83-year-old was walking across a large chunk of the eastern United States as he set a new record.
